subject: AI & Agents
title: Specialists vs Generalist Agents
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Specialists vs Generalist Agents.

buildup.text: Specialists have narrower prompts and toolsets, so they fail less.

discovery.text: Use generalists for small apps. Use specialists when tasks and risks diverge.

twist.text: Specialists increase coordination cost. You need clean handoffs and shared state.

climax.text: Choose based on errors: if one prompt keeps growing, split into two agents.

punchline.text: Narrow agents are easier to trust.

quiz.question: Why do specialists often fail less?
options: They have narrower scope and tools
